isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - INJECTION PUMP, NOZZLES, FUEL FILTER, SUPPLY PUMP AND GLOW PLUGS - FUEL INJECTION NOZZLES - INSTALLATION

step1.para: Remove protective caps from nozzle tip and bore. Then install nozzle and holder assembly, with a new copper gasket, into the cylinder head nozzle bore.

caution.para: BE CAREFUL NOT TO STRIKE NOZZLE TIP AGAINST RECESS WALL DURING INSTALLATION.

step1.para: Tighten nozzle and holder assembly to specified torque (see SPECIFICATIONS).
Remove protective covers from the fuel inlet end of the nozzle and from high pressure fuel lines.

Install two new O-Ring seals on each nozzle holder body and install the leak-off lines and tees as an assembly after nozzle installation. Refer to Figure 9.55
thru
9.58
for fuel return line routing.

note.para: Install line sensor on No. 4 cylinder nozzle, prior to injection pipe installation. Tighten line sensor to the specified special torque.
Early model fuel return line routing and installation shown for all applications except U-HAUL.
Late model fuel return line routing and installation for all applications except U-HAUL.
Early model fuel return line routing and installation U-HAUL application.
Late model fuel return line routing and installation for U-HAUL application only.

step1.para:
Connect high pressure fuel pipes to nozzle. Tighten fuel pipe connector nut to specified torque (see SPECIFICATIONS). Refer to Figure 9.59
. Use fuel line nut wrench ZTSE4133 to tighten the connector nuts to nozzles.
Purge high pressure fuel pipes of air by loosening connector and cranking engine until solid fuel, free from air, flows from connection. Retighten connection to specified torque.
Start engine and check for fuel leakage at high pressure connections and leak-off lines.
